legal_basis: Notice is given under section 1 of the Statistics of Trade Act 1947.
title: Monthly Business Survey - Retail Sales Index

description.text: If the company details or structure have changed contact us on {telephone_number_link} or email {email_link}

list: On average it takes 10 minutes to complete this survey once you have collected the information.
Data should relate to all sites in England, Scotland and Wales.
You can provide informed estimates if actual figures are not available.
We will treat your data securely and confidentially.

contents.description: If you have closed for all, or some, of the period: select 'yes, you can provide figures' and enter retail turnover, even if this is '0'.
View the survey information before you start the survey (this link opens in a new tab)
You can select the dates of the period you are reporting for, if the given dates are not appropriate.
Explain figures in the comments section to minimise us contacting you and to help us tell an industry story.

list: retail sales from outlets in Great Britain to customers abroad

sales of car accessories and motor vehicles

revenue from mobile phone network commission and top up

sales of car accessories and motor vehicles

contents.description: Please provide any additional comments about your data.

list: special events, for example sporting events
calendar events, for example Christmas, Easter, Bank Holiday
You cannot appeal your selection. Your business was selected to give us a comprehensive view of the UK economy.

The information you supply is used to produce monthly estimates of the total retail sales in Great Britain. It is also used to help estimate consumer spending on retail goods and the output of the retail sector, both of which feed into the compilation of the UK National Accounts.

question.title: Please explain any changes in your figures from previous returns, if applicable
description:
If you provide comments we are less likely to contact you with data queries.

You have nearly finished! Make sure you continue to the next page and select 'submit answers' at the bottom.

guidance.show_guidance: Show examples of comments on changes to figures from previous returns
guidance.hide_guidance: Show examples of comments on changes to figures from previous returns

contents.description: “Offer on wine for the whole month, save 25% when you buy 6 bottles. The promotion was available in-store and online, contributing to an increase in both total retail turnover and internet sales.”

“This was the month before the start of the Euro 2020 football tournament, we recorded an increase in sales of audio-visual equipment. For example, televisions and audio equipment. This led to an increase in sales both in-store and online.”
“The bad weather has decreased our sales of summer clothing. This has led to a reduction in total retail turnover and internet sales this month.”
Your response will help inform decision-makers how best to support the UK population and economy at this challenging time.
Learn more about how we use this data

submission.title: Check your answers and submit
submission.warning: You must submit this survey to complete it
submission.guidance: You will have the opportunity to view, save or print a copy of your answers after submitting this survey.
